intro: Brachyotum setosum, commonly known as the hairy brachyotum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. Brachyotum setosum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
